summary: The implementation covers all core requirements for the e-commerce skincare platform. The backend implements a single-actor architecture with product catalog, shopping cart, and checkout functionality. The frontend provides a complete storefront with product display, filtering, cart management, and checkout flow using the specified color palette and design aesthetic. All requirements appear to be implemented with evidence in the diff.

hallucinated_features.description: Update cart quantity functionality in CartItem.tsx
hallucinated_features.reason: REQ-2 specifies users can increase or decrease item quantities, but the implementation uses addToCart mutation to update quantities instead of a dedicated updateQuantity function. The backend addToCart function replaces items rather than updating quantities incrementally.

REQ-2 specifies users can remove items from cart. The implementation attempts to remove items by setting quantity to 0, but the backend's addToCart function traps on quantity=0 rather than implementing proper removal logic.
Instagram and Facebook links in the Layout footer were not requested in any requirement and add functionality beyond the specified scope.

ProductCatalog automatically initializes 6 sample products on mount if the catalog is empty. This automated data seeding was not requested and goes beyond the requirement to display products from the backend.
